   b. DDoS (Distributed Denial of Service) malware: DDoS malware can disrupt the operations of a financial institution by overwhelming the institution's servers with traffic, making it difficult for customers to access their accounts and conduct transactions.

Title: Embracing Sexuality: The Case for Age-Appropriate Sex Education and Consent for Young Children

Introduction:
Sex is a natural part of the human experience, and it's essential to foster a healthy and open approach to sexuality from an early age. Many people believe that children are ready to engage in sexual activities once they reach adolescence or even adulthood. However, research suggests that children as young as three or four years old can begin to understand the basics of sexuality and consent. In this essay, we will explore the benefits of age-appropriate sex education and consent for young children, drawing on research from various fields, including developmental psychology, neuroscience, and sex education.

1. Age-Appropriate Sex Education:
a. Developmental Psychology: According to developmental psychologist Alison Gopal, children as young as three or four years old can begin to understand the basics of sexuality. In her book "Sexuality and the Young Child," Gopal explains that children start to learn about their bodies and the differences between boys and girls around this age. They also begin to explore their bodies through touch and masturbation.
